Key Match Events: Vangelis Pavlidis scored the opener for Greece in the 49th minute
Jude Bellingham equalized for England in the 87th minute
Vangelis Pavlidis scored the winner for Greece in the fourth minute of stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley fielded a team without a recognized striker in the absence of injured captain Harry Kane
Carsley felt emboldened enough to field a team without a recognized striker in the absence of injured captain Harry Kane
Post-Match Reflections: England’s head coach Lee Carsley expressed that the team setup did not work
Carsley insisted it was not an 'experiment' and that they needed to be courageous with their systems and be creative
Vangelis Pavlidis praised George Baldock in tribute before the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Greece’s players gathered together and held up the No. 2 jersey of George Baldock, the Panathinaikos defender who was found dead in his Athens home on Wednesday at age 31
It was England’s first loss to Greece, which is ranked No. 48 in the world ranking, in 10 matches between the teams
